pr_title: CDPCP-2998. Support deleted user as part of user sync

timeline.message:
CDPCP-2998. Support deleted user as part of user sync

This updates the existing synchronizeAllUsers request to
allow specifying a single workload user to be deleted
from the freeipa. Currently this won't remove CM ranger
cloud identities (azure object ids). That will come in
a following commit.

timeline.bodyText:
I think we want to be clear that this is a workload username, not a user crn, username, etc.
We should also indicate that this workload username corresponds to the single user or machine user crn in the filters.
timeline.author: handavid

replies.bodyText: Okay, I've updated it. Since we're planning on moving to newer endpoints soon, I wasn't worrying too much about usability here.
replies.author: aarman-cloudera

timeline.bodyText: validateParameters should be updated for your userSyncRequestFilter including the users+machineUsers size when a deletedWorkloadUsername is included
timeline.author: handavid

replies.bodyText: Ah, this check was in the constructor, but I can move it to here instead.
replies.author: aarman-cloudera

timeline.author: handavid

timeline.bodyText: I don't see a matching Finished log for USER_SYNC_DELETE. I think you need to move this logging into internalSynchronizeStackForDeleteUser
timeline.author: handavid

timeline.bodyText: I think we need a test that checks the parameter validation and ensures that we reject requests with a deleted workload username that contain 0 or >1 crns.
timeline.author: handavid

CDPCP-2998. Support deleted user as part of user sync

allow specifying a single workload user to be deleted

cloud identities (azure object ids). That will come in

timeline.bodyText: is there any reason this can't be a set? it looks more flexible and I don't see why can't we delete 2 user at once
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: It has been resolved but not answered. I'm pushing this because a set would be more flexible and later you can't change this as the API has to be backward compatible.
replies.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: Sorry, my comment got lost. I did originally consider a set here, but ended up going with a single user (and had discussed with David prior to posting the PR) since it aligns with some follow on work coming up. We plan on updating user sync to only allow environment level sync or single actor sync and dropping support for something in between (like syncing N arbitrary users). This would involve adding new api endpoints and probably deprecating these existing ones. (I can point you to the design doc if you want). So I think it makes sense to keep this field single user only.
replies.author: aarman-cloudera

replies.bodyText: Okay, after further discussion, I've updated to set and added a validation that will fail if size isn't 1.
replies.author: aarman-cloudera

timeline.bodyText:
I would prefer if you pass UserSyncRequestFilter instead of adding a new parameter.
also moving the whole validation to a separate class would be nice (@VisibleForTesting annotation already a sign this method should be in another class)
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: could you move this to a separate class and refactor into multiple shorter methods
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: I've made it slightly shorter. We can do additional refactoring when working on the new sync endpoints (as mention in a previous comment), so I prefer to keep it in this class for now.
replies.author: aarman-cloudera

timeline.bodyText: I think it should fit into one log line
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: I've removed the logEvent variable so it no longer fits.
replies.author: aarman-cloudera

timeline.bodyText: I think you should either delete logEvent variable or use it in the next line also
timeline.author: lacikaaa
